intro: Apodocephala, commonly known as the "naked head" plant, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its simple, unbranched stems and small, clustered leaves. The flowers are typically small and white or greenish, arranged in umbels. Apodocephala species are often found in dry, rocky habitats and are adapted to arid environments. These plants are not widely cultivated but are of interest to botanists due to their unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
